Set #71002 Mountain Climber: Some might consider this guy to be a bit of a bland choice from Series 11, others might not, I believe he's a neat little dude with a few minor issues.

Dressed all in red and black this Mountaineer has a nice uniform look to him, he's got a single-sided torso print with a thick looking warm jacket for when he reaches the higher areas of the mountain, he has some ration pouches clipped to his belt and a nifty looking logo on his right breast. He also has harnesses printed on his legs, and he's wearing a protective helmet we've seen many times before on other sports enthusiast Mini-Figs.

Accessorywise he's got this thin rubbery coil of rope, not sure if it's actual rubber or a rubber based plastic, he also has the huge pickaxe... Uh... LEGO, I hate to say this, but most climbers tend to use smaller tools to help pound the pitons in. I mean it's fair enough that they might not have wanted to mold a new piece, however... From what I recall LEGO already has a smaller tool that would have worked out just fine here, the LEGO Res-Q Subtheme featured a bunch of tools and one of them was a small chisel looking piece that would have worked out much better with the Mountain Climber than the boring old samey pickaxe.

The facial print is a nice looking one too, with a big teeth revealing smile and some protective eye wear this Mini-Fig is ready to climb any heights. Overall I think you can't truly go wrong with him, he might be a bit less impressive than such figures as the Island Warrior or the Scarecrow, but at the end of the day he's still a great buy and a welcome addition to the Collectible Mini-Figure series.
